info.name: CleanerFlatterTwitter (Beta 2 Release)
info.description:
This is for people who want to beta test my CleanerTwitter style that cleans up Twitter!
Check out the release notes to learn all about what's in this release!
From the original CleanerTwitter: Clean up Twitter's desktop site by removing elements that aren't commonly used. Works great for small screens to get rid of the clutter!
info.additionalInfo:
Beta 2 - Fixing all the things
Quick Note:
Hey everyone! Thank's for checking out the beta!
Betas will be pretty infrequent, but, thought I'd go ahead and push the new update with all the bug fixes and all the added support of everything that was missing!
Here is beta 2!
Removals:
 - Removed more button borders! Expect less boundaries in this beta!
 - Removed more backgrounds from elements and windows! Exect smoother, more seemless experiences with this beta!
 - Removed border around re-tweets where the original tweet has been removed
 - Removed (some) separators in various areas of Twitter
 - Removed shadow from the back of the navigation bar on a person's profile page - working to make a flatter experience!
Fixes:
 - Fixed bug where bottom of some images would have a weird shadow / elongated border
 - Fixed bug where some tweets would disappear when hovering over them
 - Fixed bug where some icons would disappear when hovering over them
Changes:
 - Changed the mechanism for rounding searchboxes that aren't already round to be more reliable, and not be squares/rounded rectangles
 - Changed the mechanism for hover effects when hovering over tweets and icons to make them more reliable, and not disappear
 - Made buttons and icons a bit bolder to stand out from the background, as sometimes they would blend in a bit too much
Adjustments:
 - Made text a bit darker to stand out more from the background
 - Made slimmer indicators for navigation buttons (Home, Moments, etc)
 - (Excited about this one!) Rounded more elements such as the main stream, navbar, and more!
Added support:
 - Added support for the login screen; Users reported the login screen still had all the classic elements. Borders have been removed, and login boxes have been rounded!
 - Added support for the Messages window, the message box in conversations are now rounded!
 - Added support for more profile theme colors

Beta 1.0 - Initial Beta
Welcome to the CleanerFlatterTwitter Beta!
What's new in this beta? Take a read below!
 - New again: An entirely new design built for small and large screens, made to enhance the light and dark modes of twitter, and make the experience much more flat and minimal!
 - No boundaries: My style removes any and (hopefully) all borders on any button in every menu, popup, page, and more! It's all a part of the seamless experience with CFT!
 - Light mode? Dark mode? No problem!: CFT adapts automatically to whatever color you use for your account AND weather you use light or dark mode! It fits perfectly!
 - (Still in beta...) Clear... ness! - Most panels, tweets, forms and more will have no background making them blend right into the color behind them. Rather then setting a static color, anything sitting against the back of the page will adjust and adapt to the background of that page! Might be hard to understand, but, you'll see when you get it!
 - You ask; I deliver!: I am on a daily schedule of adjusting CFT for the look that I'm going for. When I fix under-the-hood issues, an update will be pushed shortly after, and you'll get it in no time! Something changed you don't like? Want me to test a feature? Contact me whenever you want, and I'll look into adding or adjusting per your request! Beta testers get first-hand previews and such of all the changes and features, so, feel free to contact me to join the program!
 - Get social: I post VERY often on Twitter as I chat with fellow developers along with my Software and Design team! Be sure to follow me on Twitter @Futur3Sn0w to get firsthand updates and information about what's new and changed with CFT!

Thanks for trying the beta of CleanerFlatterTwitter! Enjoy your new Twitter experience!
